title: U.S. eavesdropped on U.N. secretary general, leaks reveal
description: The leaked documents reveal the U.S. gathered intelligence on U.N. Secretary General António Guterres, shedding light on his interactions with top U.N. officials and world leaders.

title: Egypt nearly supplied rockets to Russia, agreed to arm Ukraine instead, leak shows
description: Egypt made detailed plans to export rockets at Moscow’s request, but after a diplomatic offensive from Washington, later approved artillery production for Kyiv.

title: 3 Americans missing after leaving Mexico on sailboat
description: The U.S. Coast Guard is asking for help in a search for three experienced sailors who were supposed to stop in Cabo on a trip to San Diego.

title: Tunisian Islamist leader Ghannouchi detained amid tensions
description: A lawyer for the Tunisian Islamist leader Rached Ghannouchi says he has been detained after a police search

title: CBC 'pausing' Twitter after 'government-funded media' label
description: The Canadian Broadcasting Corporation says it is pausing Twitter after the social media platform owned by Elon Musk stamped CBC’s account with a label the public broadcaster says is intended to undermine its credibility

title: Killing of jailed lawmaker on live TV puts spotlight on India’s extrajudicial violence
description: Assassins posing as journalists killed Atiq Ahmed, 60, a mobster-turned-lawmaker, and his brother Ashraf Ahmed as they answered questions on live TV.

title: Mexico president slams US 'spying' after traffickers charged
description: Mexico’s president has lashed out at what he called U.S. “spying” and “interference” in Mexico, days after U.S. prosecutors announced charges against the Sinaloa cartel for smuggling massive amounts of fentanyl into the United States

title: Sudan hospitals struggle with casualties, damage in fighting
description: Hospitals in the Sudanese capital are overwhelmed as the city turns into a war zone in fighting between the country’s two top generals

title: Two charged with allegedly operating secret Chinese police station in NY
description: “Harry” Lu Jianwang, 61, of the Bronx, and Chen Jinping, 59, of Manhattan, were arrested Monday morning in New York.

title: Israel president urges unity on Holocaust Remembrance Day
description: Israel’s president appealed for national unity as the country marked the beginning of Holocaust Remembrance Day after months of mass protests that have roiled the nation

title: Kyiv accuses Russia of undermining deal on grain shipments
description: Ukraine said the agreement, which has allowed shipments through the Black Sea despite Russia's ongoing war, was in danger of falling apart.

title: Antisemitic incidents on rise across US, report finds
description: Researchers say that antisemitism rose in the U.S. in 2022 and shows little sign of abating worldwide as political radicals have gained mainstream popularity

title: Russia's Lavrov travels to Brazil, as Lula pushes for peace
description: Russia’s Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov has arrived to the Brazilian capital as Brazil’s President Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva pushes a diplomatic approach for peace in Ukraine that has irked both Kyiv and the West

title: Who is Vladimir Kara-Murza, the Putin critic sentenced to 25 years?
description: What to know about the Russian politician and historian who was sentenced to 25 years in prison after he criticized Russia's war on Ukraine.

title: Taliban close education centers in southern Afghanistan
description: Afghan authorities say they are closing education centers supported by non-governmental groups in the country’s south until further notice

title: House of convict in notorious German cannibal case destroyed
description: Police say the former home of a man serving a life sentence for killing and eating an acquaintance in a case that appalled Germany two decades ago has burned down

title: Italian police scoop up 2 tons of cocaine bobbing in sea
description: Italian police have scooped up two tons of cocaine that was wrapped in protective plastic and bobbing in the sea off eastern Sicily

title: Italy pushes crackdown on migrants reaching its shores
description: Italy’s right-wing government is pressing ahead with plans to crack down on migrants after hundreds arrived in the last few days

title: Senegal musician Maal named UN ambassador on desertification
description: Senegalese singer-songwriter Baaba Maal has been named a goodwill ambassador for the U.N. Covention to Combat Desertification

title: Bangladesh to pay off Russian nuclear plant loan in Chinese currency
description: It is the latest instance of a country bypassing the U.S. dollar and using the Chinese currency to conduct international payments.

title: Hong Kong bishop visits Beijing on historic trip
description: Hong Kong’s Roman Catholic bishop arrived in Beijing on Monday, marking the first visit to the Chinese capital by the city’s bishop in nearly three decades, despite signs of Sino-Vatican strains

title: Freak storm in Thailand capsizes fishing boats, killing 3
description: Officials in Thailand say a freak storm in the country’s south has capsized a dozen fishing boats and killed at least three people

title: Slovakia gives Ukraine remaining 9 of 13 promised warplanes
description: Slovakia has delivered the remaining nine of the 13 Soviet-era MiG-29 fighter jets that it promised to Ukraine

title: Putin hails Russian navy's performance in Pacific drills
description: Russian President Vladimir Putin has hailed the military’s performance during massive naval drills that involve the entire Russian Pacific Fleet in a show of force amid the tensions with the West over the fighting in Ukraine

title: Russian opposition activist given 25-year prison sentence
description: A court in Moscow has convicted a top Kremlin foe on charges of treason and denigrating the Russian military and sentenced him to 25 years in prison

title: Russia sentences Kara-Murza, Putin critic and Post contributor, to 25 years
description: The longtime political activist and opinions contributor to The Washington Post was convicted of treason for opposing Russia's war in Ukraine.

title: Chinese national arrested on blasphemy charges in Pakistan
description: Pakistani police say a Chinese national has been arrested on blasphemy charges after he allegedly insulted Islam and the Prophet Muhammad

title: Saudi-led coalition releases additional Yemen war prisoners
description: A Saudi-led military coalition has started freeing 104 more prisoners captured in Yemen’s war, a unilateral release that followed an organized prisoner swap amid renewed diplomatic efforts to halt the conflict

title: US helicopter raid in Syria targets an Islamic State leader
description: The U.S. military says a helicopter raid by U.S. forces in northern Syria has resulted in the “probable death” of a senior leader of the militant Islamic State group

title: Firefighters battle France's 1st major forest blaze of 2023
description: Hundreds of firefighters are steadily wrestling under control France’s first major forest fire of the year

title: Ex-leader Merkel to be decorated with highest German honor
description: Former Chancellor Angela Merkel is to be decorated with Germany’s highest possible honor in recognition of her near-record 16 years at the helm of the country

title: Clinton, Blair to mark Northern Ireland peace milestone
description: Former U.S. President Bill Clinton and past leaders of the U.K. and Ireland are gathering in Belfast on Monday, 25 years after their charm, clout and determination helped Northern Ireland strike a historic peace accord

title: Ukraine live briefing: China hails security ties with Russia; Warsaw and Kyiv in urgent talks on grain
description: The European Union’s executive arm criticized Poland and Hungary after protests by farmers prompted them to temporarily ban the import of Ukrainian grain.

title: Violence in Sudan for third day as civilian death toll rises to 97
description: The U.N. World Food Program is temporarily halting operations in Sudan amid fighting between the military and the RSF paramilitary group.

title: The ‘old Europe’ vs. ‘new Europe’ paradigm is back
description: Former secretary of defense Donald H. Rumsfeld’s rubric of an “old Europe” juxtaposed against a more vibrant — and, from Washington’s perspective, amenable — “new” Europe endures, 20 years later.
